data.title: BBC Scotland
data.meta_description: BBC The Social features contributors from all over Scotland.
data.text:
Maddie Hill

Maddie Hill is an Actor, Presenter and Social Media Influencer with over 1 million followers across her platforms. Growing up in the Orkney Islands, Maddie developed a passion for theatre, dance and history at a young age. Maddie began making content with The Social in 2022 and since then has worked on BBC related programmes online, on radio and in shortform. Maddie started posting beauty style videos online in 2020 and since then has grown into a successful content creator working with some of the biggest brands in the world. Maddie is keen to work in other areas of the industry as a presenter in kids tv, news and relatable Scottish content.

Rosalind Main

Rosalind is an artist, radio presenter, model and body image campaigner from Leith, Edinburgh. She is interested in working on topics surrounding the arts, social media and body image. In 2017 she co-founded the 'I Am More Than' project online which has been growing from strength to strength, celebrating body inclusivity and hosting annual shows around the central belt. Since November 2023, Rosalind has been presenting a monthly radio show with her Dad called 'Borrowed Nostalgia' which looks at music venues around Edinburgh past and present. Rosalind is always excited to contribute to, and find out more about Scotland's creative scene!

Ty and Dex

Ty & Dex are a content creating/ musical duo who have been best friends since high school. Ty and Dexter both share passions in performing arts, digital storytelling and presenting. Together they formed the band known as “Scratchcard Wednesday” where they have already gained early success and recognition from some of the UK’s biggest artists. They are also known for their head to head challenges or their public interviews where you will see the pair asking the people of Glasgow just about anything! The pair bounce off each other with their cheeky banter and competitive spirit! The boys are extremely excited and committed to making entertainment their full time job!

Rosie Graham

Rosie is based in the Scottish Borders and is a 4th year student at Queen Margaret University, where she is studying BA (Hons) Drama. In her spare time, Rosie loves performing with her local musical theatre group and exploring new places with family and friends. As well as her love for all things film, tv, theatre and radio, Rosie loves learning about and researching local history. In 2016, she was diagnosed with Ulcerative Colitis and since then has been passionate about raising awareness of the impact of Inflammatory Bowel Disease. Rosie hopes to pursue a career in the arts when she graduates in 2024.

Jack Brown

Jack is a 21-year-old, Lanarkshire-born, student who studies Broadcast Production at UWS. Jack loves to make Scottish sketch comedy that will make a difference. This could be in the form of scripts, being on camera and taking on the chance to present or host. Also claiming to have a keen eye for fashion, Jack runs a fashion-based website in which he reports on the world of attire in the form of blogs, interviews, videos and podcasts. Passionate about fast fashion and its effects, he tries his hand to re-work, re-imagine and recycle garments in any way he can.

Beth Alexandra

Beth Alexandra is a TikTok content creator based in East Ayrshire. She currently has over half a million followers across her social media accounts. Beth mainly posts content surrounding British TV shows and nostalgia, alongside different comedy sketches and fashion inspo. She is currently studying Fashion Branding at Glasgow Caledonian University where she is able to express her creativity and passion for all things fashion. She was recently able to work with BBC Sounds on the Waterloo Road podcast where she could show her love for BBC shows. Beth has also collaborated with CBBC to share content for across their social media channels of CBBC inspired outfits.

Kara Gillespie

Hi my name is Kara Gillespie, people know me as Cochlear Kaz on my social media! I’m 18 years old and I’m profoundly Deaf. I wear bilateral Cochlear Implants. I am also autistic! I’m a social media content creator from Motherwell. I love making videos to make people laugh and to raise Deaf / Autistic awareness. My favourite TV show is Stranger Things. I'm absolutely obsessed with it!

Katie Urquart

Katie is 24 years old, grew up in the Scottish Highlands, where she recently returned to and now lives. Shes works freelance in hospitality and a range of creative endeavours and has an affinity for creativity, community and digital storytelling. Katie is passionate about giving back to her community through both volunteer and fundraising work and using her voice to amplify causes and people she cares about; namely regarding relationships with body image and mental health. This is the focus of her content creation is something she would love to expand on. Especially for her fuller-bust peers. The rest of her content is dedicated to her mis-adventures and whatever hobby she has decided to make her personality that week.

Adam Smith

Adam Smith is an award-winning documentary filmmaker from Edinburgh, Scotland. During his studies at Napier University, he produced the out-of-this-world film Space Queens about the women behind Apollo 11 at NASA, which has been shown at film festivals and schools around the UK and Ireland and in 2021, produced a follow up with female astronauts. He is passionate about baking, space and creating content for YouTube and TikTok.

Aidan McDonach

Wishaw based filmmaker, specialising in the sound department, with a passion for music and film! Loves collaborating on all types of content, from sketches, documentaries, and short films. Originally from a music production background, now made the switch to working freelance in the film/tv industry. Particularly likes meeting new, interesting and talented people, and the different places/situations you find yourself in while doing this job!

Ailsa Gillies

Ailsa Gillies is a freelance journalist and writer from the Isle of Bute who dabbles in almost every form of media creation. She recently completed a BA (Hons) in Film, Media and Journalism and is currently doing a MSc in International Journalism with hopes of travelling the world to utilise her skills.

Aimee McCabe

Filmmaker, editor, photographer and Epilepsy Advocate who loves all things weird and wonderful. Aimee wants to capture people’s life stories and is no stranger to share her stories and experiences. 100% the weird quirky friend in the group and wants to make people laugh and believe they can achieve anything they have their mind set on.

Ami Torrance

Ami comes from a little village near Paisley called Elderslie and currently works in content design. She’s been writing since she could hold a pen. She writes a lot of poetry, and gets inspired by everyday situations, emotions and human interaction. She’s a big advocate for mental health and wellbeing, a lover of animals and a hater of awkward silences. Ami wants to give people a front-row seat into her brain and give them something they can relate to, and maybe even make them chuckle at the same time.

Amy Cox

Amy Cox is an Edinburgh-based photographer, actor, and filmmaker. As a recent graduate from Edinburgh College of Art, with a Master’s in Contemporary Art Practice, Amy continues to develop her work exploring gender and femininity. Her images and films look at the paradoxical duality between the fragility and strength of women while drawing on the influences of vintage American cinema.

Amy Leith

Amy is an aspiring entertainer with a passion for making people laugh, she does this by making videos on YouTube talking about her experiences and overall thoughts. She hopes to develop this further and put her comedic skills to good use, while also venturing onto other things like singing/acting and performing.

Andy McDonald

Andy is a Glasgow-based writer who's penned words about music, games, movies and more for the likes of Vice, Playboy and Official Nintendo Magazine. Through his work, he likes to examine a subject's cultural and historical significance with a personal or human interest angle. In his spare time, he lives the rock 'n' roll lifestyle with his band – as much as an office job allows anyway.

Bella Bree

Bella is an American who moved to Edinburgh after being in a long distance relationship with a Scotsman for two years. She enjoys sharing stories about her life, albeit sometimes embarrassing ones, as she navigates living in a new country. She has fallen in love with Scotland and refuses to stop talking about all her favourite things.

Ben Clarke

A passionate and striving individual with both game design and programming skills, Ben’s focus is to deliver engaging and meaningful content to the masses. Whether that be through his video content or his experience with games journalism, he's always aiming to provide fair, just and thoughtful coverage of whatever topic is at hand. Determination is his game, and he hopes to show everyone what he’s made of in the games industry.

Blair Calen Kidd

Better known as Hitsu-Cosplay; Blair is a Cosplayer, Model and all-round Nerd creating cosplay content for YouTube, Instagram and Tik Tok. His characters hail from all medias such as anime, DnD podcasts and video games. Most of the time he is travelling the UK to guest at Comic Cons with his improv group “Bandursnatch Studios”. With a BA Hons in TV Production under his belt and being the youngest tv-tech to work at the 2014 Commonwealth Games, he has joined his two passions together to create tutorials and cool cosplay music videos for others to enjoy.

Brice Ledingham

Brice is a comedian, writer and musician, based in Stirling and Glasgow. A film and media graduate from the University of Stirling, Brice spends his time not using his degree, and instead performing on the Scottish comedy circuit and writing original songs about the obscurities of modern life. He used to be able to play piano by ear, these days he uses his fingers instead.

Bronwyn Gilgallon

Bronwyn Gilgallon is a young artist from Glasgow. Born with a language and communication disorder Bronwyn couldn’t hear or speak until the age of six. Her way of communicating was through drawing, which is how she discovered her talent. Bronwyn's style is colours, cartoons, a touch of manga/anime, fantasy, pet portraits and anything Scottish basically but Highland Cows are a particular favourite and what she’s best known for.

Caitlin Stuart-Delavaine

Caitlin is a Glasgow-based medic and past Training and Recruitment Co-ordinator for her university’s Nightline. These passions have motivated her to create content highlighting current inequalities faced by women in both healthcare and every day life. She hopes by doing this, she can advocate ways in which we can all make a positive change.

Calum MacDonald

Calum hails from the Highland capital of Inverness, but if you met him, you'd be having second thoughts (he really doesn't have the accent). He recently obtained his certificate for HNC Sound Production. In his free time, he likes to mingle in Photography, play video games as well as listening to EDM and is also producing his own music. He also has autism, but you really wouldn't be able to tell if you met him.

Calum Shiels

Calum is a 23 year old Scottish writer and director. Through working on sketches, short films and web series’, he has experience with everything from comedy to drama to documentary. From the thrill of working freelance to the joy of supporting St Mirren he is never far from disappointment, however he hopes that his content doesn’t leave you feeling more let down than a 3-nil loss to Hamilton on a wet Wednesday evening!

Charlie Parker

Charlie Parker is an award winning Writer, Director and has featured on TEDx. He has had a history in comedy web content. The show he co-created with comedians Daniel Sloss and Tom Stade, M.U.F.F., won best online comedy at the Scottish Comedy awards. Recently he has been working on a gaming parody web series, Media Mashups alongside writing and directing partner Jack Fox.

Chloe Donald

Chloe is a YouTuber and Influencer from Fife. With over 200k followers on her social media accounts. An LGBT activist and winner of Scotland's Inspiring Young Creator Of The Year award 2016! Mostly known for her rainbow hair and work with YouTube sensation Roman Atwood, they both featured in a video with over 3 Million views!

Christina Sinclair

Christina is a marine biologist, wildlife nerd and aspiring nature presenter who is on a mission to get people more connected with the environment. She can often be found getting far too excited about Scottish wildlife and wants to share her love with as many people as possible. She does this by making videos, taking photos and babbling away to anyone who will listen about that cool crab she just saw.

Claire D'All

Claire is the creator of A Journey In My Wheels - a blog with social media and YouTube channels. She shares her accessibility reviews of places she has visited and talks about important disability awareness topics from first-hand experience due to being born with congenital muscular dystrophy and using a powered wheelchair since the age of 3. By sharing her life stories and thoughts she hopes to change the negative perspective that some people have about living with a disability.

Claire Lim

Claire Lim aka Wee Claire is a presenter, podcaster, writer and geek pundit. Claire promotes nerd culture in a fun, youthful and positive light, regularly encouraging engagement and discussion about film, TV and comics online and bringing, what some would consider, geeky topics and subject matter to the masses. For BBC The Social, she’s chatted about the Scottish apocalypse with Jeff Goldblum, strong women with Jamie Lee Curtis and diversity with Chloë Grace Moretz, and regularly interviews big stars from around the globe.

Cole Thompson

Described by many as a “walking/talking IMDB” and always skint from maintaining their massive film collection, Cole’s love for the strange and surreal transcends through their content. Having Asperger’s Syndrome, Cole strives to expose the overlooked comedy and wonder that horror & fantasy have to offer onto the mainstream audience. They are also reportedly a big fan of Kate Bush.

Dr Danielle Farrel

Dr Danielle Farrel is a disability rights advocate, passionate about providing a voice for those living with a disability and ensuring they are empowered to make informed decisions about their lives. Danielle has cerebral palsy and has never been one to follow the crowd. She loves to embrace her individuality and support other disabled individuals to do the same, so they’re never afraid to be themselves.

Danny Carr

Danny is a writer and filmmaker who is from Glasgow. Danny writes comedy sketches for 'The Social.' Danny views the world as full of pain and dullness. So he tries to counter that by becoming a demi-god from making people smile, even if they don't want to.

Elettra Arnell

Elettra was born in 1992, in Italy. She is half Swedish as well, and has traveled the world, working and making short films. She has studied film making in Italy, in Denmark, Sweden, and in Scotland. She loves to explore themes such as loneliness, lost, violence, difficult love, hate etc. She likes what seem to be ugly, rotten, dirty and distorted, as those things can hide incredible stories we can't even imagine.

Ella Williams

Ella is a footballer, sports feminist, and the creator of women’s football project, Futfemreflect. She's also a postgraduate researcher at the University of Edinburgh where she is exploring girls’ experiences of football in PE with an aim to contribute towards improving those experiences. Through her project and research, she wants to open the discussion on women’s football and inspire more girls and women to give it a go.

Elliot Bibby

Elliot is an award winning professional magician based in Edinburgh. He can regularly be seen performing his comedy magic on stages around the world and was nominated for the Fringe Festival Comedy Award in Australia. He’s Scottish Magician of the Year and has had sell out shows at the Edinburgh Fringe.

Elliot Caunce

Photo-journalist, film-maker; multi-media artist. Elliot is a visual-storyteller based in Dundee with a passion for creating immersive and evocative human-interest stories. He is known widely for his ability to get under the skin of his subjects, often holding a lens to the under-represented and the human aspect of environmental issues. Get in touch if you think you have a story worth telling or want to collaborate on a future project.

Emily Christie

Emily is a Scottish writer and content creator based in Dundee. She is very fond of impractically large earrings, horror films and organised fun. Her writing has been featured in publications including New Writing Scotland, Potluck Zine, The Wee Review and Marbles Mag. Emily loves making comedy and lifestyle content on topics such as fashion, friendship and mental health and is always looking for a new hobby to try.

Erin Kelly

Erin is a writer, performer and poet from Edinburgh. Her work tackles social issues, predominantly dealing with feminist subjects. She is the 2018 winner of the “write to end violence against women awards” and frequently uploads poetry videos on her social media platforms. She loves collaborating with female filmmakers and creating work that challenges people to think outside their comfort zone.

Essa Flett

Elisabeth Flett is an award-winning writer, theatre-maker, musician and general feminist trouble-maker. As a folk musician she has won competitions such as the 2015 Cecil Sharp House Fiddle Championship and reached the semi-finals of both the BBC Radio 2 Folk Awards in 2017 and BBC Radio Scotland Young Traditional Musician in 2021. Her work as a writer has been published by zines and magazines. Elisabeth is passionate about mental health awareness, LGBTQ+ rights and gender equality, themes which often feature in all forms of her work as a creative practitioner.

Ewan Marshall

Ewan Marshall is a filmmaker from Morebattle, Scottish Borders with experience working on productions all across the UK. He has recently began to use the knowledge and experience he has gained to produce his own work. Ewan is also an avid traveller having adventured around the world including driving to Russia and living in Canada for a year.

Flora Bird

Flora is an actor, working and living in Scotland. She has a degree from the University of Glasgow in Scottish Literature and has been working as a professional actor for the last three years. She likes to create comedy that makes fun of the surrealism of everyday life.

Florian Niederseer

Florian is an artist from a tiny mountain village in Austria. The stage is his home on which the performs as an actor, a slam poet, singer, dancer or even host. He displays his LGBTQ+ activism mainly through his written and spoken word and got featured in “Fantastische Queerwesen und wie sie sich finden”, the first German Queer Slam Poetry Anthology. While he’s not touring the stages of Europe, he loves to put his headset on and always appreciates a good video game.

Fraser Gillan

Fraser is an online presenter and journalist. He presents and produces "Up for discussion" and is known for meeting and interviewing people who have been in harsh circumstances and putting himself in situations that others wouldnt. Fraser is mostly known for his real life mini docs about alcoholism, knife crime and more.

Gemma Stroyan

Gemma is an actress and writer. Trained separately in both Acting and Journalism, she has a particular love for the power of truthful storytelling through words, both written and spoken. She has toured U.K theatres and her voice can be heard in an award-winning video game, the Scottish Bafta winning Last Commanders for CBBC and several times for STV and radio. As well as having a love for comedy, Gemma is particularly passionate about exploring subjects of human interest. These include grief, trauma, the positive impact of animals on our mental health, and the benefits of being active in nature and the outdoors.

Giulia Candussi

Giulia is a documentary filmmaker and photojournalist passionate about women’s rights, alternative lifestyles and the environment. She wants to tell the stories of people whose voices might not otherwise be heard and raise awareness about human and environmental issues. She regularly makes mini-documentaries for BBC The Social and her first documentary ‘Against the Tide’ premiered at Glasgow Film Festival in February 2021.

Grace Nicoll

Grace is a freelance broadcaster and DJ originally from Campbeltown in the Mull of Kintyre but now lives in the Highland capital of Inverness where she has spent the last 6 years of her life. She has many different shades (we call it the 50 Shades of Grace) that can see her looking into the iconic scenery of Scotland, hitting the gym, exploring the Scottish rave scene, holidays and even dealing with hard topics such as bereavement.

Grant Martin

Grant Martin, an Aberdeen born YouTuber who’s passionate about making people smile, and giving them the opportunity to think differently about the world we live in. His motto, “Life’s too important to take seriously”. Grant has travelled to up to 65 countries in the world and when in doubt asks “What Would Oprah Do?”.

Harleen Nottay

Harleen is a Scottish Punjabi born and raised in Edinburgh. She has had a diverse working life spending much of her youth as a dancer and modelling after participating in Britain's Next Top Model in 2010 ,whilst studying Business Management with Entrepreneurship and working in corporate sales. She has a huge passion for all things health; whether that's physical, mental or emotional and wants to use her platform to help promote mental health in ethnic minority communities. Her ultimate goal is to use all this experience to move into interviewing and presenting.

Isobella Hubbard

Isobella Hubbard is Scottish actress and writer from the Highlands. Since graduating she has worked across film, TV and stage and has just wrote and shot her first short film 'Beat It' which is currently being subbed for festivals. She has a big love for comedy.

Jack Fox

Jack Fox is an award winning Writer, Director & VFX artist. Having been making short high concept comedy sketches since he was a teenager, Jack has found an audience online with his work continuing to win awards and entertain millions of people around the world. With technical and artistic experience in filmmaking and visual effects as well as a passion for performing, Jack brings a unique style to his videos.

Jamie Kirk

Jamie Kirk is a father and bus driver. Since early 2018 he has taken all of his funny stories from these two focal points in his life to the stage as a stand up comedian. If you get on his bus, just don't ask him why he is late.

Jamie MacColl

Jamie MacColl is an internet funny man and presenter with experience in writing and self-shooting. He began making surreal and absurdist comedy sketches at the young age of 13, and hasn't stopped since. He recently appeared on the BBC Scotland TV pilot 'Islelanders' and hosted 'The Younger Games' on BBC iPlayer. He is super handsome, incredibly talented, and did not write this.

Jamie Murray

Jamie is an experienced videographer and content creator based in Scotland. With a unique perspective on modern Scottish society, having grown up on the Isle of Bute on the west coast of Scotland and having experience in youth politics, Jamie is dedicated to creating engaging and informative factual content that accurately reflects the diverse and complex reality of modern Scotland. Jamie's passion is to use his skills to tell compelling stories that can make a difference.

Jenny Lester

Jenny is an Edinburgh-based writer and performer who loves to make people laugh. Her work is informed by her work at a women’s rights charity. She was previously a waitress, frozen yoghurt sculptor, and Christmas elf. In her spare time, when she finds it, she plays Dungeons and Dragons and learns Scottish Gaelic.

Jessica Secmezsoy-Urquhart

A Scottish-Turkish writer, filmmaker and disability historian with imposter syndrome. Working class, Non-binary, Autistic and Bi. Has a connective tissue disease, anxiety etc. Their spine is the only straight thing about them… Despite having a First, they sucked on game show Impossible. Using lenses and pens to make sense of the world. They seek to give a voice to the marginalised at every turn, whether through historical research on Tudor fools, creating fictional films like The Constant Companion about recovering from abuse(based on their experiences), LGBT interview photography projects, or creating inclusive diverse content online.

Jill Clark

Jill is from Glasgow and has cerebral palsy. She uses a wheelchair and a communication device and does a lot of campaigning for disabled peoples’ rights including changing places toilets and AAC (augmentative and alternative communication). Jill’s goal in life is to help people to have a better understanding of disabled people and make the world more inclusive.

Julie McElroy

Julie McElroy has a PhD in Assistive Technology and is dependent on technology to lead her life the way she wants to, due to having Cerebral Palsy, which has resulted in walking difficulties along with a speech and hearing impairment, and manual dexterity problems. She brings energy and passion to anything she turns her hand to.

Katie Williams

Katie is eager to tell the stories that often go unheard. Katie is an award-winning multimedia journalist and podcast creator based in Stirling. All stemming from her own experience, such as, working as a waitress, and being part of Holyrood's first all female parliamentary committee; Katie investigates issues including hospitality, mental health, and feminism.

Katrina Allen

Katrina is a quirky comedy actress and writer from Edinburgh. She has often been likened to a ‘Panda in Ballet shoes’: plenty of grace but no coordination. Since graduating from East 15 Acting School she has worked in theatre and film. She has a love for making people laugh and is passionate about exploring mental health, feminism and everyday issues in her work. She is also a co-creator of One More Stone Productions, with whom she has produced and taken on the lead role in a number of award winning short films. Those films took the group to Seattle, LA, Paris, Orlando and more. When not acting and writing, Katrina can be found running around in nature, climbing trees and constantly tripping over her own feet.

Keiren Hay

Kieren is a content creator based in Glasgow who grew up loving TV programmes and video games. He took this passion into the creative industry by creating his own YouTube channel where he creates content focused on upcoming games. He also went on to study TV Production in Glasgow to learn how to actually create the stuff he spends all of his time watching.

Kris and Dave

Kris J. Cummins and David O. Gray are an award winning sketch duo (formerly known as Grave Day). They’ve been making comedy sketches since they were 17 about a dog turd and it’s been strength to strength since. They’ve been making style-driven comedy for The Social for over a year and are creators of wildly successful series Planet Janet.

Laura Sharp

Laura Sharp is a spoken word artist, poet and hula hoop performer. Coming from the small town of Forres on the Moray Coast, Laura spent four years travelling the world and is now based in Glasgow. Her creative work is focussed on telling the truth through storytelling and whose sassy and soulful performance style can be found at spoken word stages and festivals throughout Scotland.

Laura Young

Laura Young aka 'Less Waste Laura' is a climate activist, environmental scientist, and advocate for living sustainably, currently living in Glasgow. Since the beginning of 2018 she has been on a journey to make her personal lifestyle more sustainable through reducing her plastic use and carbon footprint, advocating for a whole lifestyle response to the injustices we see everyday across the world. From fashion to food, travelling to homeware, Laura has been seeking out the more ethical and sustainable practices for individuals and businesses alike.

Lewie Watson

Lewie is an actor, writer and poet from Elgin, he is passionate about continuing the conversation and raising awareness around mental health. As an actor Lewie has worked in Shakespeare productions as well as New Writing. He has been a part of a directorial team that was nominated for an Offie Award in 2020. Recently Lewie was part of the Breakthrough Writers programme at Edinburgh’s Traverse theatre and his latest script has been selected for a Page2Stage event.

Luca Calone

Luca Calone is an Italian filmmaker and actor based in Glasgow, who worked as an actor and director for several years in Italy, acting in TV programs, independent movies, theatre and producing his own shorts and TV pilots.Today he works as a professional filmmaker, shooting a broad range of content, from corporate to music videos and shorts, whilst writing scripts with the aim to produce his first feature film.

Mandy Jones

Glasgow based, Mandy is Scottish blogger and former stripper who writes mostly about mental health and body positivity. Her blog is called The Empowered Woman Project. Passionate about women’s rights and LGBTQ+ rights, she tackles controversial issues head on both on and off line. She’s keen to move into broadcasting full time and The Social is providing a great platform to learn new skills.

Martin Ritchie

Martin finally did something about his passion for comedy when he started making silly sketches for the internet. Self-taught in the workings of cameras and the art of comedy writing, his only aim here is to try to get a laugh – but he might settle for a wee grin.

Megan Shandley

Megan is an actress, comedian, writer and singer from Edinburgh. She trained at LAMDA. In 2019, Megan was part of films premiering at both Venice Film Festival and BFI London Film Festival. She was a 2018 Funny Women Grand Finalist and a 2017 Scottish Variety Award Nominee. Megan is a regular on the Scottish stand-up comedy circuit and has performed in comedy clubs and festivals all over the UK and beyond. She performed her first solo stand-up ‘Megazoid’ at the Edinburgh Fringe 2019.

Michael McGorry

Michael, a former Film, TV, and Radio student from Ayrshire, has always had a passion for being the centre of attention. He enjoys creating silly vlogs, sketches, short films, and presenting multimedia quizzes. He takes immense joy in analysing and watching movies for both YouTube and TikTok. However, despite his constant critiques, he humbly acknowledges his lack of ability to produce anything better. Is there anything this man wouldn't do? Answer- no.

Nathan Byrne

Nathan is an actor who writes and films things in his back garden when his Game Boy runs out of batteries. He also has a degree in Human Physiology that he sometimes put in the recycle bin to wind up his mum.

Nathan McCuaig

Nathan is a recent film and television production undergraduate who studied at The University of Cumbria Institute of the Arts, and now is completing his master's degree in Film Producing at Edinburgh Napier. He has a keen interest in activism, music, and comedy, alongside filmmaking. He is also very fond of long walks on the beach.

Nicole McGuire

Nicole is a YouTuber based in Glasgow, who goes by the username nicoleeo. She’s all about the self-deprecating sense of humour. Nicole is also known for her meme-like editing style. Her type of content varies, from gaming videos, skits, to videos where she speaks passionately about her interests and also interactive videos involving her audience. Her particular type of content has allowed her to work with companies such as Universal Music, as well as featuring an issue of Shout Magazine. In 2018, Nicole was a creator on the Small YouTuber Panel at the popular YouTube event “Summer in the City” and she also works closely with BBC The Social to create gaming content.

Olivia Topalian

Olivia is a half Scottish, half Armenian creator and researcher based in Glasgow. Olivia started making TikTok videos in March 2020, leading to her working with The Social and BBC Short Stuff by the end of that virus-ridden year. Olivia‘s videos range from comedy shorts to presenting factual content which is brought to life with hand-drawn digital animations. Olivia has a First Class B.A. Honours degree in Sculpture from the Glasgow School of Art, but will not publicly admit to still enjoying an occasional paper-mâché project.

Olivia Wilson

Olivia is a broadcast journalist and producer at the BBC. She has a wealth of experience working in live TV and radio production, as well as producing social and digital content for online output. Olivia has a particularly strong interest in current affairs and social issues, having produced a video on the Black Lives Matter protest on Glasgow Green for BBC The Social which gained over 50,000 views on Facebook in a few days.

Dr Punam Krishan

Dr Punam Krishan is an NHS GP with a specialist interest in public health, family and lifestyle medicine. She is also a medical educator, teaching at the University of Glasgow. Alongside this, Punam is a writer and TV presenter. As a proud Scottish Indian woman, Punam is always keen to bring all aspects of her diverse personality to the forefront of all she does and where possible, will turn anything into a meaningful prescription for life!

Rachel Laird

Rachel is a film-school drop out who loves videography, photography and storytelling. She is passionate about health awareness after having a couple of cancer diagnosis and a stem cell transplant. In her spare time, Rachel likes to take herself out for nice dinners, buy herself gifts and eat seriously decadent treats.

Rachel Shnapp

Rachel is an aspiring film director and writer. She is currently focusing on screenwriting. She is interested in different ways of using film, such as film poetry and eco-criticism through the lens. Rachel has just finished working at National Geographic, and is inspired by topics around gender, home and the environment.

Raylla Duarte

Born in Brazil, Raylla is a self-taught filmmaker and photographer who now lives in Scotland. She has a degree in Journalism and uses those skills to produce mini-docs about people's personal and powerful stories. She has a passion for human’s narratives and their unique experiences and ways to see the world. Raylla is also a martial arts student, a self-proclaimed supertaster, an animal squeezer and has an insatiable desire for learning at least three hundred and eleven skills.

Raymond Garrett

Raymond was born a total 4 times, and on the 4th he came out sprinting on 8 legs singing the song that will end the world. Send help please we don't know how he got in here.

Renu Bhardwaj

Renu is a passionate and active lifestyle influencer & mum, who strives for a healthy work life balance. Her love for food stems from family meals she ate around her mum’s kitchen as a young girl. Renu loves recreating the times she had growing up in an Indian household while blending in Scottish home influences with a twist. Renu believes home cooked food options should be exciting and varied and champions healthy choices to create a fake-out Friday meal.

Ross McLaren

Ross is a scuba diver and hillwalker who has recently been diagnosed with anxiety issues. Through his adventures in Scotland he tries to show that “an adventure doesn’t have to be an expedition” and even the smallest of walks (round the park, down the beach) can have the biggest of impacts on your own mental health. Everyone knows the beauty Scotland has to offer on the surface, but not so many get the opportunity to see what lies beneath the waves. Through his “poor excuse of underwater photography and videos” (his words) Ross tries to give us a taste of the spectacular sights to be found beneath our waterline.

Sam Pirie

Sam is a Libra with a love of theatre, film and comedy. When he's not on stage in some bizarre costume you can find him writing comedy sketches and listening to ABBA. Sam loves to entertain people and hopes to give you a good laugh in some form or another. If laughter is the best medicine, think of Sam as your friendly neighbourhood pharmacist.

Sanjeev Mann

Sanjeev is a journalist, content creator featured in The Scotsman, BBC The Nine, Hip Hop Scotland, and has a love for all things music, film, gaming, and Liverpool FC. The MLitt Media and Communications graduate (with distinction) prides himself on producing content on a variety of relevant subjects from gaming and socialising to the legalisation of marijuana and disability rights issues. The hip-hop enthusiast is also a music producer- and makes beats for several Scottish rappers. In addition, Sanjeev is a development worker for the Pathfinders Neuromuscular Alliance. A charity that aims to promote quality of life for people with Duchenne Muscular Dystrophy and other similar conditions.

Sannah Hussain

Sannah is a Volunteer Coordinator within the Islamic Charity Sector. She is also a radio presenter and producer who has Albinism, is partially sighted and suffers from an incurable muscle weakening disease. Yet despite this, Sannah spends much of her life advocating for equality and inclusion for people with disabilities and illnesses, and those from ethnic minority communities. In 2019 she took up boxing and entered the ring once already to prove that anything is possible.

Sarah Grant

Sarah is a Glasgow born and bred writer, poet and filmmaker. Her first film, "The Cyclist", won the Dream to Screen competition and was debuted in every Cineworld in the UK and went on to be nominated for a BAFTA Scotland New Talent Award. From there, Sarah went on to make films with One More Stone Productions, which she co-founded, whose films have taken the collective to Seattle, LA, Paris, Orlando and more. More recently, Sarah founded Coven Productions, committed to storytelling that is honest, feminist and fearless. Sarah is the only Scottish person to ever win the UK wide Sky Academy Arts Scholarship. She is also a writer and poet. Her debut collection, When Sarah isn't working (which is rare, the millennial condition is real) you can find her buried in a book, driving around the countryside or eating more mashed potatoes than any one human can handle.

Sarinah O'Donoghue

Sarinah is a final year English Literature student who is truly in her element around books and furry creatures. She is passionate about disability acceptance, feminism, climate change awareness, and chips and curry sauce (in no particular order). She is governed by one primary goal: do your best to leave the world in a less hostile state than when you entered it.

Scott Alexander

Having been a fan of video games, film, books and such for his best years, Scott decided he'd try and spread his wisdom to the wider world, rather annoyingly. Whether it's debating which Uncharted is the best of the series or discussing why The Last Jedi is a poorly made movie, Scott is there to jump into the conversation. He also enjoys the outdoors, history and a good bagel.

Scott Tumilty

Scott knows quite a bit about games, and he's not too bad at talking to cameras either. He fought for Sega in the Great War, and watched GamesMaster the first time around, cause he's old.

Sean Wilkie

Sean is a writer, comedian and stay-at-home dad from Coatbridge. He reached the finals of So You Think You Write Funny in 2016 with his sitcom The Graduettes and currently makes his own web series Sit-Down Dad. Sean was once Tom Baker’s stand in on Monarch of the Glen and made cocktails with Giles from Buffy.

Shiona McClafferty

Shiona is a Deaf content creator from Scotland. She graduated from the University of Stirling in teaching and is passionate about raising awareness to promote inclusion of deaf people in all aspects of life. Shiona aims to inspire young people to achieve their dreams while proving that you can do anything you set your mind to.

Sidrah Hassan

Sidrah is a Scottish Pakistani Woman working in the tech industry. She is particulary interested in the digital ethics of tech and AI because of her passion for inclusion and equity for minority groups. She's also a keen foodie and desert fiend, finding the best Halal spots across the Central Belt

Stella Radeva

Stella is a student and freelance journalist currently based in Glasgow. For the past four years she has worked and studied on three different continents with Hong Kong being her favourite location. She is passionate about beer (being almost named after one), tanks and reporting on protests.

Stephanie Symington

Stephanie has a love for all things gym and fitness: with a particular love of Ice Skating. She has been skating for 15 years and also coaches at her local ice rink. Stephanie has a degree in Media and Communications: she loves to create, learn new skills and has ambitions to be a TV presenter one day.

Stephen Kirkwood

Stephen Kirkwood is a DJ, Music Producer and Entrepreneur living in Dumbarton, Scotland. He has released house, techno and trance music on some of the industries biggest labels such as Spinnin' Records, Subculture, Respekt Recorgings and Yosotoshi to name a few. His music has taken around Europe playing sets in some of the most iconic super clubs like Amnesia and Privilege in Ibiza as well as Braehead arena and the Royal Highland centre in Edinburgh. Stephen also founded electronic music studio SKapade Studios in his home town of Dumbarton in 2015.

Stephen Morton

Awright, my name is Stephen. Time to bore you to tears. Didn't do much of anything. Nothing of note at least. I got into making weird, almost comedy, but not quite, videos on Youtube - out of sheer boredom. And it is a laugh as well. I just needed something to do. Suppose I am a bit of a comedian. With a wee Twitch side hustle as well. And of course, I can't forget – an enthusiastic content creator for the BBC Social. That's the hard sell over.

Steven Galloni

Big Gal is a positive ball of energy who loves comedy, music & making people smile. He creates fun content & his Instagram stories are usually wild! He also runs a music studio with his partner in crime, Stephen Kirkwood working all over Scotland. These two have have had fun since day one & now they plan to bring it to the BBC Social.

Stuart Hay

Stuart is a comedy writer and actor from Glasgow best known for his football related sketches. His work at The Social has seen him make national radio appearances and be part of the writing team for shows like Only An Excuse. He is also a cast member of BBC Scotland show “May Contain Nuts”.

Susie Jay

Susie is a producer at ExploreMore Media, she's produced two short films this year and has just graduated from University, where she studied Filmmaking and Screenwriting! She likes to keep herself busy with creative work whether it's writing scripts, making YouTube videos or even being an extra for television from time to time.

Taryam Boyd

Taryam is a Scottish-Arab comedian/actor from Glasgow. He has a passion for storytelling - whether it be, sketches, poetry or stories from his own life or others. He loves physical theatre and is class at juggling. If you see him - tell him your stories.

Ty & Dex

Dexter is a content creator and musician from Glasgow studying at The Music School of Douglas Academy and the Royal Conservatoire of Scotland. Tyrese is a Scottish/ Nigerian content creator and musician, raised in Glasgow. He discovered his love for performing while playing in academy of Hamilton Academical from the age of 13. You’ll normally find them on the streets of Glasgow asking the public their opinions on just about anything. Together they're in a band called Scratchcard Wednesday.

Vanessa Kanbi

Vanessa Kanbi is a 26 year old Scottish/Ghanaian married mum of two. After pursuing a modelling career for ten years in London and Edinburgh she shifted her focus to become a videographer and podcaster. Vanessa has her own Youtube channel and podcast ‘Magnificent Mothers’ where she regularly posts, alongside creating videos for The Social.

Victoria Masterson

Victoria is a freelance video producer, journalist and writer based in Edinburgh. She’s insatiably curious and loves telling people’s stories. Vicky also loves high-end TV drama and documentaries, and has secretly always wanted to write something that gets on the telly. You never know! She hopes studying a Masters in Factual TV development at the University of Stirling might help. Vicky’s motto for life is “just do it.” She also likes to paint, draw and rake through skips. She’s passionate about helping people and the planet.

Vito Milazzo

A director of short films that has seen his work screened globally and described as “visionary” (no, really), Vito’s current day job as a broadcast TV editor doesn’t stop him chronicling the decay of modern life and the demons that drive us.

Waco Yokoyama

A Philosophy and Film graduate taking a year out in Tokyo as a Swimming Coach and Lifeguard. With a love for reading and adventures, Waco also particularly enjoys making films, ranging from experimental music videos to the research and people based documentaries, especially focusing on the current climate issue. She hopes to spread awareness this importance and suggest ways that we can combat this issue.

Wallace Currie aka Rural2Kitchen

Wallace is an agricultural lecturer from the Isle of Arran who spends his spare time promoting sourcing local good, backing British farming and creating content on Facebook, Instagram and YouTube. His biggest focus is his podcast, the R2Kast which has various guests from the agricultural industry talking about their experiences. He also works with RHET to bring rural education into primary classrooms throughout the country.

William Downe

William Downe is a photographer from Ayrshire, now based in Glasgow who has built his way up in photography through subject matters like portraits but primarily through his work taking photos of various bands in Western Scotland & touring with them. He also promotes the bands and the shots on his Instagram.

Yutsil HDM

Yutsil is a Scottish/Mexican Glasgow based filmmaker with a passion for collaborating with interesting individuals and capturing compelling stories. His interest lies in developing intimate portraits of people and places, using his camera to convey the story. From working with his friends making short films to working in the Film & TV industry, he continues to pursue film as a career.

Zahra Faqir

Zahra is a Scottish Pakistani researcher and an aspiring presenter, who has recently moved to the north of Scotland. She is passionate about opening up conversations on subjects that are often not discussed, immersing herself in new cultures and falling over in public places.

Zarah Hill

Zarah Hill is a filmmaker, presenter, comedian and creator of the series ‘Cooking for Mugs’. Zarah’s experience with creating content started out with her passion for feminism and experience in martial arts. She has since taken on almost every genre you can find on The Social and has experience in many aspects of production.

Zuzanna Kapitula

Zuzanna is an aspiring documentary filmmaker and a keen traveller, who much like a cat, has her own ways of telling stories. Through her content, she hopes to show the world from different perspectives and give a voice to less represented people and places.

Zoë Swann

Zoë is an illustrator, musician and filmmaker based in Dundee. She loves to tell stories - whether that’s her own experiences and ideas, or helping share the stories of others. When she’s not working, Zoë enjoys watching movies, looking after her houseplants, and working on her wide array of celebrity impressions.
